DataElement.preferredName: Generalized Anxiety Disorder 7 Item Questionnaire How Difficult Have Problems Made it to do Work Take Care of Things at Home or Get Along with Other People 4 Point Scale
DataElement.preferredDefinition: A person's stated observation for how difficult the problems identified in the questionnaire made it for them to do their work, take care of things at home or get along with other people, using a four point Likert scale.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Generalized Anxiety Disorder 7 Item Questionnaire How Difficult Have Problems Made it to do Work Take Care of Things at Home or Get Along with Other People
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: A seven item validated, self-reported questionnaire for screening, and assessing the severity of generalized anxiety disorder in clinical practice and research settings._A question about how difficult problems have made it for an individual to do work, take care of things at home, or get along with other people.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: A standardized survey developed by Robert L. Spitzer and colleagues in 2006 which is used to identify probable cases of generalized anxiety disorder and assess the severity of an individual's symptoms. This instrument consists of 7 items and one follow-up item. Each item is rated on a scale of 0-3 where 0 is 'not at all' and 3 is 'nearly every day.'

Concepts.definition: A seven item validated, self-reported questionnaire for screening, and assessing the severity of generalized anxiety disorder in clinical practice and research settings.

Property.preferredName: How Difficult have Problems Made it to do Work, Take Care of Things at Home, or Get Along with other People
Property.preferredDefinition: A question about how difficult problems have made it for an individual to do work, take care of things at home, or get along with other people.

ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: An ordered reference standard consisting of 4 points from not difficult at all to extremely difficult.
